content: As I can't ping a team, I think I can reach you here. :)
Looks like it was an auto-fallible job, which are allowed to fail without failing the build.
this was caused by unattended-upgrades running in the background btw
Oof. Self hosted runners continue to seem no fun at all.
I just want some aarch64 github-hosted builders is that too much to ask?

@Pietro Albini Ouch. I've had experiences like that putting AWS images together. Does Ubuntu have fstrim.timer, systemd-tempfiles-clean.timer, or e2scrub_all.timer? You'll want to disable those too if so.
Also, apart from aarch64 Linux, what targets would you need "native" support for (vs cross-compiling)?
We want native builders for all tier-1 targets, I believe, because otherwise "We run tests" is a bit ... well, questionable
like, "we run tests in qemu" is a start but is really not ideal
@Josh Triplett I'll take a look tomorrow
